intro: Collinsia bicolor var. typica, commonly known as the California popcornflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It features showy, bilaterally symmetrical flowers in shades of pink and white, typically arranged in a raceme. The plant has linear, grass-like leaves and produces small, fluffy seed heads that resemble popcorn, giving it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in coastal scrub and chaparral habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it a notable species in the Polemoniaceae family.
